items.sentence: I was in Boston for almost the entire summer.
I was looking for Tom, but he found me first.
I was pretty fortunate to be able to do that.
Tom falls asleep as soon as he gets into bed.
Tom fell asleep as soon as the movie started.
Tom felt comfortable inside his sleeping bag.
Tom felt it was important that you know this.
Tom finally made up his mind to ask Mary out.
Tom scratched the back of his neck nervously.
Tom searched the glove compartment for a map.
Tom seemed to know exactly what he was doing.
Tom sells vegetables on the side of the road.
Tom shared his chocolate bar with his friend.
I\'ll never be able to explain what happened.
I\'ll never ever forgive Tom for what he did.
I\'ll never forget the day when we first met.
I\'ll never forget what Tom told me that day.
I\'ll pick up a loaf of bread on my way home.
I\'ll probably be able to come to your party.
Tom is only pretending that he doesn\'t know.
Tom is the one that didn\'t want you to know.
Tom should tell Mary that she has to do that.
Tom speaks French better than his classmates.
Tom speaks French much better than Mary does.
Tom squeezed himself through the narrow door.
Do you think that\'s what\'s happened to Tom?
Have you ever parked your car on this street?
Have you ever read been convicted of a crime?
Have you ever tried doing it this way before?
Have you ever tried not being rude to people?
I have a few household chores that I must do.
I have a lot of things that I must deal with.
I have a pick, two shovels and a wheelbarrow.
I have a pretty good idea where Tom might be.
Please don\'t interrupt me when I\'m talking.
The baseball game was called off due to rain.
Tom asked Mary what kind of movies she liked.

You shouldn\'t judge others by how they look.
It\'s been thirty years since we got married.
It\'s easy to get lost, so please be careful.
It\'s not as easy to do that as people think.
I heard that Tom and Mary want to talk to me.
I heard that Tom got married to a rich woman.
I heard that Tom is planning to come with us.
